title: Secret Tool for Moving Pigs! || Setting up Kune Kune Rotational Grazing Paddock || Pastured Pigs

tasks.task: Interacting with farm animals and pets.
subtasks: Holding a friendly interaction with a jumping companion (Liam).
Observing and engaging with cows, possibly enjoying their company.
Feeding pigs (Bowser, Peaches, and others) and attempting to introduce them to new food (black walnuts and pumpkins).
Managing chickens' access to walnuts.
Moving and adjusting fence positions for rotational grazing and animal management.
Using bread as a lure to safely capture a wandering pig (possibly Bill).
Rescuing a pig that may have escaped or sought a new area.
Picking up fallen walnuts and loading them into a wagon.
Distributing food to animals (e.g., pigs, Coonies, ducks) as part of farm management.
Setting up an electric net fence for rotational grazing.
Preparing shelters for pigs (e.g., tarped area, pallet shelter for the winter).
Moving and adjusting existing shelter structures (e.g., cow shelter repurposed for dogs).
Constructing basic shelter elements (e.g., walls and ceilings) for pigs using pallets.
